detaileddescription.para: The queue, actually storing the processes waiting for products
The initial number of products in the Bin
The maximum number of products in the Bin
Number of products available at the moment
Number of producers having visited the Bin
Number of consumers having visited the Bin
Weighted sum of available products in the Bin over the time (must be divided by the total time to get the average available units!)
The last time the Bin has been used
Indicates the method where something has gone wrong. Is passed as a parameter to the method checkProcess().
Counter for the SimProcesses which are refused to be enqueued, because the queue capacity is full.
Flag to indicate whether an entity can pass by other entities in the queue which are enqueued before that entity in the queue. Is false per default.

memberdef.argsstring: (desmoj.core.simulator.Model owner, String name, int sortOrder, int qCapacity, long initialUnits, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: Bin

detaileddescription.para: Constructor for a Bin with a number of initial units of a product in it. The queueing discipline and the capacity limit of the underlying queue can be chosen, too. Highest priority are always first in the queue.

parameterdescription.para: Model : The model this Bin is associated to.
int : determines the sort order of the underlying queue implementation. Choose a constant from QueueBased like QueueBased.FIFO or QueueBased.LIFO or ...
int : The capacity of the queue, that is how many processes can be enqueued. Zero (0) means unlimited capacity.
long : The units of a product the Bin starts with. Must be positive.
boolean : Flag, if Bin should produce a report or not.
boolean : Flag for trace to produce trace messages.

memberdef.argsstring: (desmoj.core.simulator.Model owner, String name, long initialUnits, boolean showInReport, boolean showInTrace)
memberdef.name: Bin

detaileddescription.para: Constructor for a Bin with a number of initial units of a product in it. The underlying queue has a Fifo queueing discipline and unlimited capacity.

parameterdescription.para: Model : The model this Bin is associated to.
long : The units of a product the Bin starts with. Must be positive.
boolean : Flag, if Bin should produce a report or not.
boolean : Flag for trace to produce trace messages.

detaileddescription.para: Returning the average number of products available in the bin over the time since the last reset of the bin.

simplesect.para: double : The average number of products available in the bin over the time since the last reset of the bin.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a Reporter to produce a report about this Bin.

simplesect.para: desmoj.report.Reporter : The Reporter for the queue inside this bin

detaileddescription.para: Method for consumers to make the Bin deliver a number of n products. When there are not enough products available or another consumer is first in the queue to be served (and it is not possible to pass by), the current consumer process will be blocked and inserted in the waiting-queue.

simplesect.para: boolean : Is true if the specified number of units have been delivered successfully, false otherwise (i.e. capacity limit of the queue is reached).

parameterdescription.para: long : The number of products the Bin is delivering to the consumer.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of units available at the moment.

simplesect.para: long : The number of units available at the moment.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of consumers having visited the Bin.

simplesect.para: long : The number of consumers having visited the bin.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the initial number of products in the bin.

simplesect.para: long : The number of products the bin started with.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the maximum number of products in the bin.

simplesect.para: long : The maximum number of products in the bin.

detaileddescription.para: Returns whether entities can pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue.

simplesect.para: boolean : Indicates whether entities can pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of producers having used the Bin.

simplesect.para: long : The number of producers having put products in the bin.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the implemented queueing discipline of the underlying queue as a String, so it can be displayed in the report.

simplesect.para: String : The String indicating the queueing discipline.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of entities refused to be enqueued in the queue, because the capacity limit is reached.

simplesect.para: long : The number of entities refused to be enqueued in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: To reset the statistics of this bin. The number of available products at this moment and the processes waiting in the queue are not changed. But all statistic counters are reset. The QueueBased is also reset.
Sets the flag passBy to a new value. PassBy is indicating whether entities can pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue.

parameterdescription.para: boolean : The new value of passBy. Set it to true if you want entities to pass by other entities which are enqueued before them in the queue. Set it to false if you don't want entities to overtake other entities in the queue.

detaileddescription.para: Method for producers to put a number of n new products in the Bin. When producers store() new products n is positive. Producers can always store products into the Bin and will never be inserted in a queue and blocked, because the Bin has no capacity limit..

parameterdescription.para: long : The number of products put into the Bin.

detaileddescription.para: Activates the SimProcess process, given as a parameter of this method, as the next process. This process should be a SimProcess waiting in the queue for some products.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : The process that is to be activated as next.

detaileddescription.para: Activates the first process waiting in the queue. That is a process which was trying to take products, but it could not get any because there were not enough products for it or another process was first in the queue to be served. This method is called every time a producer has given new products or a consumer in the waiting-queue is satisfied.
Checks whether the entity using the bin is a valid process.

simplesect.para: boolean : Returns whether the SimProcess is valid or not.

parameterdescription.para: SimProcess : Is this SimProcess a valid one?
String : The method having called checkProcess() as a String.

detaileddescription.para: Updates the statistics for producers and consumers.

parameterdescription.para: long : Is positive when producers store() new products in the bin and negative when the Bin deliver()'s products to the consumer process.

detaileddescription.para: Bin is the place where producers can store their products for consumers to come and use them up. Bin is used to implement process synchronization between producers and consumers. Producers are producing products and store them using store() in the bin. Consumers make the Bin deliver() the products to use them up. If no or not enough units of a product are available for the consumers, they have to wait in a queue until new units are delivered by a producer. The first sort criteria of the queue is always highest priorities first, the second queueing discipline of the underlying queue and the capacity limit can be determined by the user (default is FIFO and unlimited capacity). Bin is derived from QueueBased, which provides all the statistical functionality for a queue.
